titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Joseph Hopkins Twichell Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Sunday December 9, 2018 at 06:11

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Collection contains correspondence, writings, and personal and professional papers documenting the personal life and activities of Nineteenth- and early twentieth-century American pastor Joseph Hopkins Twichell. Correspondence consists of letters from Twichell, chiefly to his family, dating from 1855 to 1864, and incoming letters from Frederick Edwin Church, William Reed Eastman, and others. There are notebooks and scrapbooks dating from Twichell's service in the 71st New York Volunteers during the Civil War and later material, including journals, travel diaries, notebooks, scrapbooks, photograph albums, and drafts of sermons and speeches, document his personal and clerical activities.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Joseph Twichell and Mrs. Charles Ives, 1951, and Charles P. Twichell and Mrs. Burton P. Twichell, 1967.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Joseph Hopkins Twichell Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Joseph Hopkins Twichell Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and in some instances minimal organization. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, identified by a unique call number and titled according to month and year of acquisition.

The finding aid for this collection is compiled from individual preliminary lists for each acquisition that were created at or around the time of receipt by the library. The preliminary lists were migrated to comply with current archival descriptive standards and merged into a single file in 2007-2008. As part of the migration, modifications were made to the formatting of individual lists; however, the content of the lists was neither modified nor verified. During baseline processing of the collection in 2013, minor revisions were made in the arrangement and description.
This finding aid may be updated to account for revisions in arrangement and description.
Former call numbers: Za Twichell and Uncat Za Ms 167.

bioghist.head: Joseph Hopkins Twichell (1838-1918)
bioghist.p: Joseph Hopkins Twichell was born 27 May 1838 in Southington, Connecticut to Edward Twichell and Selina Delight Carter. He attended schools in Southington and graduated from Yale University with the class of 1859. He began his theological studies at Union Seminary in New York, but they were interrupted by the outbreak of the Civil War, during which he served as chaplain of the 71st New York Volunteers. After the war, he resumed his theological studies at Andover Theological Seminary and, in 1865, he took over as pastor of Asylum Hill Congregational Church in Hartford, Connecticut, where he remained until his death.
Biographical information taken from "Joseph Hopkins Twichell." Dictionary of American Biography . New York: Charles Scribner's Sons, 1936. Biography In Contex t. Web. 21 June 2013.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains correspondence, writings, and personal and professional papers documenting the life and activities of nineteenth and early twentieth century American pastor Joseph Hopkins Twichell. Correspondence consists of letters from Twichell, chiefly to his family, dating from 1855 to 1864, and incoming letters from Frederick Edwin Church, William Reed Eastman, and others. There are notebooks and scrapbooks dating from Twichell's service in the 71st New York Volunteers during the Civil War and later materials, including journals, travel diaries, notebooks, scrapbooks, photograph albums, and drafts of sermons and speeches, document his personal and clerical activities.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three groupings: May 1945 Acquisition, October 1967 Acquisition, and October 1967 Acquisition.

controlaccess.subject: Authors, American -- 19th century -- Archives
Clergy -- Connecticut -- Hartford
Congregational churches -- Sermons
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army. New York Volunteers, 71st

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subdivisions, Journals and Civil War Letters, and arranged chronologically within each subdivision.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The May 1951 Acquisition consists of twelve autograph manuscript journals dating from 1874 through to 1918, and letters from Joseph Hopkins Twichell to his family and others. The journals also contain scattered clippings and letters.
Gift of Joseph Twichell and Mrs. Charles Ives, 1951.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Entries dated from April 8, 1915 - April 13, 1915 are by Twichell; later entries are in an unidentified hand, possibly by Susan Twichell

did.unittitle: Volume O: Various things that may be of interest to my children

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into eight subdivisions: Civil War Material, Correspondence, Miscellaneous Material, Notebooks, Scrapbooks, Sermons, Speeches, and Travel Diaries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The October 1967 Acquisition contains Civil War material, correspondence, travel diaries, notebooks, scrapbooks, and drafts of sermons and speeches. Correspondence consists of letters from Twichell to his parents, dating from 1855 to 1861, and letters from others, including Frederick Edwin Church and William Reed Eastman.
Gift of Charles P. Twichell and Mrs. Burton P. Twichell, 1967.

did.unittitle: ["Memorabilia of the Civil War, Vol. I"?], scrapbook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains memorandum and copy of letter from S. Parkes Cadman

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by venue and event.

scopecontent.p: The second October 1967 Acquisition contains five photograph albums.
Former call number: Uncat Za Ms 167.
Gift of Charles P. Twichell and Mrs. Burton P. Twichell, 1967.
